summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from April 8, 2021, coordinating logistics for FBI agents to assist with the evidence review for the Ghislaine Maxwell case. It details the schedule (April 13-15, 2021), security protocols for Maxwell, and the roles of the AUSA and SOS personnel.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the evidence review. She is to be produced by the Marshals, monitored by FBI agents, and will be present with her defense team.

persons.name: AUSA
persons.context: Will be present for all three days of the evidence review, has reserved proffer rooms, and will meet the agents.

persons.name: SOS
persons.context: Will be present all three days, is familiar with the case, and agents are encouraged to reach out to her.

connections.description: The AUSA is part of the prosecution team overseeing the evidence review for the case against Maxwell.
FBI agents are tasked with monitoring Maxwell, escorting her, and maintaining custody during the evidence review.
SOS is a resource for the assisting FBI agents due to her familiarity with the Maxwell case.

events.title: Start of Maxwell Evidence Review
events.description: First day of a scheduled three-day review of evidence by Ghislaine Maxwell and her defense team, monitored by the FBI and AUSA.

events.title: Maxwell Evidence Review Day 2
events.description: Second day of the scheduled evidence review.

events.title: Maxwell Evidence Review Day 3
events.description: Third and final scheduled day of the evidence review.

keyFacts: The FBI was coordinating a secure, three-day evidence review for Ghislaine Maxwell and her defense team from April 13-15, 2021.
Security protocols were strict, requiring an FBI agent with a handcuff key to monitor Maxwell at all times, including escorting her to the bathroom.
The AUSA reserved three proffer rooms in the courthouse: one for evidence, one for the defense to confer privately, and one as a break area for law enforcement.
An individual referred to as 'SOS', familiar with the case, was to be present as a resource for the assisting FBI agents.
